intro: Melicytus flexuosus, commonly known as the flexible melicytus, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for native birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in conservation programs to support local biodiversity.
